message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper deals with optimization of a specific type of function and gives a reduction from one setting to another. This falls under the scope of algorithms and data structures. 
2. cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) - The paper deals with lattice functions and constraints, which are topics in discrete mathematics. 
3. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - Submodular functions are commonly used in machine learning for feature selection and other applications. The paper's focus on optimization of DR-submodular functions may be of interest to researchers in this field. 
4. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - Similar to cs.LG, submodular functions are used in AI for various applications. The paper's focus on optimization of DR-submodular functions may be of interest to researchers in this field as well. 
5. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the running time of the reduction and the size of the resulting submodular instance, which are topics in computational complexity.
